intro: Luzula fastigiata, commonly known as the upright sedge, is a perennial plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. This species is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and spikes of small, usually green or reddish-brown flowers. Luzula fastigiata typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or wetland habitats. It is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
